intro: Cyclopogon neglectus, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It is often found in wet or moist environments such as marshes and swamps. Cyclopogon neglectus is relatively uncommon and is typically found in specific geographic regions within its native habitat.
